service.name: Carer Adjustment Payment
service.description: Carer Adjustment Payment (CAP) is a payment for families where, following a More Informationcatastrophic event involving a young child aged under seven years, the family is going through a period of significant adjustment as a result of the care needs of the child. The CAP is to assist families with additional costs during their adjustment period immediately after the event.

Dimension.name: Carers
Dimension.desc: There are payments and services available if you provide daily care to someone with a severe disability or medical condition or someone who is frail aged.

Dimension.name: Centrelink
Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.

Dimension.name: Human Services
Dimension.desc: We deliver social and health-related payments and services
